Sentencas: To improve the performance of solid oxide fuel cells (SOFCs) at intermediate temperature, an idea of adding a negative thermal expansion (NTE) oxide into cathode is proposed.
Titulo: Application of a negative thermal expansion oxide in SOFC cathode

Sentencas: The effects of NdMnO3-delta (NM) NTE oxide addition in Ba0.5Sr0.5FeO3-delta (BSF) cathode on the performance of proton-conducting SOFCs (H-SOFCs) are studied.
Titulo: Application of a negative thermal expansion oxide in SOFC cathode

Sentencas: The 30 wt % NM addition can lead to an ideal thermal matching between BSF-NM cathode and BaZr0.1Ce0.7Y0.2O3-delta (BZCY) electrolyte, and improve the electrochemical performance of H-SOFCs significantly.
Titulo: Application of a negative thermal expansion oxide in SOFC cathode

Sentencas: At 500-750 degrees C, the peak power density (PPD) of H-SOFCs with BSF-NM cathode is 139-941 mW cm(-2), which is apparently higher than that (73-661 mW cm(-2)) with BSF one.
Titulo: Application of a negative thermal expansion oxide in SOFC cathode

Sentencas: In addition, the relative increment of peak power density (PPD) increases from 42.36% at 750 degrees C to 90.41% at 500 degrees C, which is seldom obtained by conventional cathode doping.
Titulo: Application of a negative thermal expansion oxide in SOFC cathode

Sentencas: Comprehensive results of electrochemical impedance spectra, electrical conductivities, and SEM observations show that the apparent improvement of PPDs should be mainly associated with the increased three phase boundary length due to the ideal thermal matching between cathodes and electrolytes.
Titulo: Application of a negative thermal expansion oxide in SOFC cathode

Sentencas: In all, it provides a novel idea to develop intermediate and low temperature SOFCs.
Titulo: Application of a negative thermal expansion oxide in SOFC cathode
